info.title: Axiora API
info.description: Developer infrastructure for Japanese financial data

get.description: Shallow health check — confirms the process is alive.
Deep health check — verifies DB connectivity.
Return data freshness metrics. Public endpoint, no auth required.

Search companies by name, securities code, or EDINET code.

Returns results ranked by match quality: exact code matches first,
then prefix matches, then substring matches.

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Results to skip (ignored when cursor is set)
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: Results to skip (ignored when cursor is set)

parameters.name: expand

schema.description: Comma-separated sub-resources to include: financials, ratios, growth, peers, segments, translations, health_score
schema.title: Expand

parameters.description: Comma-separated sub-resources to include: financials, ratios, growth, peers, segments, translations, health_score

get.description: Computed financial ratios for a company over time.
Year-over-year growth rates and multi-year CAGRs.

Get the health/credit score (0-100) for a company.

Returns a transparent score with component breakdown, flags,
and industry adjustment.

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Results to skip (ignored when cursor is set)
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: Results to skip (ignored when cursor is set)

get.description:
Filing calendar: companies with period_end in the given month.

Useful for knowing which companies' annual reports are expected.
Returns companies grouped by their fiscal year end date.
Retrieve English translations for a filing's text sections.

Full-text search across translated filing content.

Returns relevant matches with highlighted snippets, ranked by relevance.
Uses PostgreSQL tsvector/tsquery for full-text search.

Rank companies by a financial metric.

Returns top N companies sorted by the chosen metric, with the
metric value and basic company info.
List all sectors with company counts.

Aggregate financial statistics for a sector.

Returns median, average, min, max for key metrics across all
companies in the sector.

Side-by-side financial comparison of multiple companies.

Returns financials and computed ratios for each company,
aligned by fiscal year for easy comparison.

Find peer companies (same sector, similar revenue size).

Returns companies in the same sector, ordered by closest
revenue to the target company.

Time-series data for a single metric across one or more companies.

Returns data in a chart-friendly format: one array per company,
each element being {fiscal_year, value}.

Export financial data as CSV.

Returns companies' financial data in a flat CSV format suitable
for analysis in pandas, Excel, or any data tool.
At least one filter (sector or fiscal_year) is required.

Export financial data as JSON array.

Returns companies' financial data as a JSON array, one object
per company-year. At least one filter (sector or fiscal_year) is required.
List all API keys for the authenticated user.

post.description: Create a new API key for the authenticated user.

get.description:
Data coverage statistics — metric availability, freshness, totals.

Shows what percentage of companies have non-null values for each
financial metric. Use this to assess data completeness and trust.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.default: Base 50 + stability (max 20) + profitability (max 20) + cash flow (max 10) + industry adjustment (±5). All inputs derived from audited XBRL filings.
